abstract.p: US Institute of Museum and Library Services grants Museums at Stony Brook (Long Island) $37,949 to restore its 19th-century Gypsy Wagon; fund-raising is underway to raise additional $22,000 (S)

block.p: The 19th-century Gypsy Wagon in the collection of the Museums at Stony Brook is about to be refurbished with the help of a $37,949 grant from the Institute of Museum and Library Services, a federal agency that supports museums and libraries.

''This project will help to reveal the brilliant colors of the surface, which is covered with decorative paintings,'' said Merri Ferrell, curator of the carriage collection and manager for the project.

The 19th-century Gypsy Wagon in the collection of the Museums at Stony Brook is about to be refurbished with the help of a $37,949 grant from the Institute of Museum and Library Services, a federal agency that supports museums and libraries.

''This project will help to reveal the brilliant colors of the surface, which is covered with decorative paintings,'' said Merri Ferrell, curator of the carriage collection and manager for the project.
The total cost for the conservation of the wagon is estimated at $59,949, and fund-raising efforts are under way to raise the additional $22,000.
